page.title: 04CANON PYON PARISH ROOM
page.content: Built in 1913 by the{church}as a {Reading Room,}Canon Pyon Parish Room is a centre for village activities.It is currently holder of the{'Herefords. {Best Kept Village Award'.}It is run by a committee of local people.In 1979 extensive alterations and improvements were carried out.There are complaints about the heating,which is expensive, noisy and inadequate in winter.{Discos are banned at present (much to the disgust of the young people) due to damage caused by outsiders.On one wall is an imposing{'Odd Fellows'}banner discovered in an attic at the Nag's Head Inn.Some local older men belonged to the 'Odd Fellows',an Insurance Benevolent Society.The Hall is used by the W.I.,Toddlers Group,Over 60's,Keep Fit,Parish Council,Rifle Club,British Legion,Pyon Players,School,Doctor and Churches etc.Hire rate -Â£2.50per hour.
